p: In Europe, leishmaniasis is the most prevalent disease transmitted by phlebotomine sandflies, which is caused by two parasites: Leishmania infantum, responsible for visceral leishmaniasis, and Leishmania tropica, responsible for cutaneous leishmaniasis. In the Mediterranean area, L. infantum is endemic, while L. tropica arises periodically in Greece and neighbouring countries. The transmission of these two parasites is highly influenced by temperature.
